documents.document: @SecondCaptains Was so busy all day I didn't see this until now. Delighted - the week just got a lot better!
@cormacpro Exactly...what I fear is that this is just laying the groundwork for things to get much, much worse.
@cormacpro Now that really is asking for trouble...
Galway looking extremely fancy today https://t.co/whyAQ6Vm1G
Plus we have a new area focusing on the events of 1917...weekend plans, anyone? https://t.co/xP2zUAx4hT
Great to see @nerve_centre @Creative_100_ resources looking v impressive in our @NLIreland WWIreland exhibition https://t.co/9G73JeABCY
Happy 135th Birthday Mr Joyce! And Happy 95th Anniversary of Publication Day to your big blue book. https://t.co/ijGFwGll6W
@louisemcsharry After I first ran 10k someone in work said - "well, if you can do it, anyone can." Truth.
@louisemcsharry Oh, you are so capable of it! The feeling of being able to run when previously you couldn't is pure joy.
@DrMagennis A year later, this remains one of the funniest things I have ever read.
First outing of the year coming up this Saturday...looking forward to being back on the road #mayogaa https://t.co/lEKMtuyqXJ
@kenearlys Increasingly unsure how many more days any of us are going to last, to be honest...
@pohara And values -hard work, decency, recognition of the worth of others - that seem in starker relief than ever this weekend.
@MrPaulDuane I think he would hate the absolute desertion more...
@Maria_Brid Maybe you just look very chic and French? Try joining the gym in Trinity! The oldest people there are literally half my age...
@Maria_Brid Were you time traveling again?
@MrPaulDuane He's saving something up for Week 2
Woop woop - nail biting following this on Twitter...❤️💚❤️💚 https://t.co/BHovHiPMK2
@oliverburkeman That is the perfect encapsulation of what I have been trying to articulate to myself all weekend. Thank you.
@mamster Which may not be a ringing endorsement, but on the plus side our President is a left-wing poet.
@mamster Much better than it used to be.
@mamster Come live with us here in Ireland! We love a fiery rant!
I have just added gin and Campari to my shopping list #Inauguration
Packed house here @NLIreland for Helen Shenton of @tcdlibrary speaking as part of our "Library Matters" series. https://t.co/xlMeobLtD7
Very excited to be @DubrayBooks for the launch of our lovely friend @aocdotme 's book #thehappymedium https://t.co/r5sbY9ql0a
@RichieSadlier Your secret's safe with me.
@RichieSadlier Although, thinking about it, it might dramatically reduce the interviewee pool if people keep leaving as weeping wrecks.
@RichieSadlier Fantastic, illuminating interview with @lukefitz11 . Make sure to make the next guy cry though.
@robinsonmj07 Congratulations! Hope you and the crisps had a very happy day!
@eoinmcdon @NiamhNiB @CMoonDL @caitlinnicg Wow, that's quite the coincidence!
@FrenchfoodieinD There is the lovely @HanselGretel_ie on Clare Street...
Discussion for @firstfortnight on migration at @david_monahan's Beyond Leaving" exhib at the Photographic Archive https://t.co/k25WiIOctm
@cormacpro Perhaps some kind of mutually beneficial swapping arrangement? More than happy to help you out 😜
@Gusclaw You're on!
@MarianKeyes Hilarious, and touching, plus musical numbers! What's not to love? xx
@MarianKeyes I watched the whole series on flights to and from Australia, and it was the only thing they kept me from going MITH altogether.
@Gusclaw I am aiming for the Dublin Marathon - perhaps we can knife each other? 😜
@johnauldwebster Can't beat the west of Ireland! Happy New Year.
@OlwenCD The 4 stages of returning from the cattery: Ignoring - Furious Staring - Needy Meowing - Return to Standard Indifference
@natalieharrower 😢 Lots of fluids, and staying in bed!
@janholmquist Happy New Year Jan!
Here's to fizz and friends and kindness - and standing together to fight any battles we need to in 2017. https://t.co/y5NYBygRae
@greg_jenner Such fond memories of reading your book in France last summer. Thanks, and here's wishing for a 2017 that's kinder to all.
@Gusclaw Go for it, and enjoy every mile!
@MrNiallMcGarry @DavidsonJenn Our year, Niall! These M&Ms predicted the future https://t.co/H5eCTtV7gB
Thawing out from @leinsterrugby match and settling in for cosy NYE at home https://t.co/B78LPxrsqc
"If you see Someone, say Someone's safe"...listening to @BoxOfDelights84 and making mince pies...proper Christmas Eve!
@hughtweet @MaddockCarol Finally something to talk about...
A night of Buffy @SydOperaHouse ...not sure it gets better than this https://t.co/xUzCvbnOrJ
Excited to be here @SydOperaHouse listening to @borrelli tell us how tv got good - and arguing against cultural tiers #BingeFest
@eoinmcdon Good shout!
Last day working in @Library_Vic It's been lovely! https://t.co/1oTshODw0r
@CarolineMcGee Yes, til Monday, then on to Sydney. Certainly enjoying so far!
Viktor&Rolf: Fashion Artists @NGVMelbourne utterly beautiful, captivating, witty...loved it. https://t.co/mwRuckd2gr
Part of my ongoing quest to sample every baked egg in Australia https://t.co/Eyx7CWJKxR
@MauriceLinnane Too late to be up in Ireland, Mr Linnane!
@cormacpro Alternatively, you could try being in Australia for three weeks - I'm finding that pretty helpful.
@cormacpro Take some sweets from a child today - it will help you rebalance.
@cormacpro Ah now, you cannot blame Christmas for all the terrible things done in its name
@natalieharrower Sorry/not sorry 😜
@natalieharrower Hope it all goes really well - sorry I can't be there!
@finndelaney Correct use of apostrophes being one of the small pleasures, I take it!

Hello Perth - you're doing a great job so far. https://t.co/Q227l3PKDZ
After 22 hours traveling, total bliss to be clean, lying down, and listening to the sound of the ocean...
Australia bound! https://t.co/NOjdKj8Kiw
Gorgeous run in Regent's Park this afternoon - London looking wonderful on a perfect, still winter's day.
@DowClaire What can I say? Bit keen by nature!
Mincemeat made, bags packed for Australia, and a magnificent Ireland win. Decent Saturday. https://t.co/ZaktnAiGVn
Now that was something! #IREvAUS
@elizabethcraft Happy Thanksgiving Elizabeth! You and @gretchenrubin bring a lot of joy to people worldwide and we're grateful.
@MarianKeyes If he's a God she probably is too. So it's the family business and she probably always expected him to go into it in the end.
@MrPaulDuane Eoin's always has really good vegetarian dishes in the restaurant @FallonandByrne
Great to see so many colleagues at the @conulireland Strategy launch https://t.co/MiXTabQ9s0
@cormacpro God help them, poor creatures.
@cormacpro Plus side, rather.
@cormacpro It is (but on the place side that's a great expression I don't hear often enough in Dublin 😜)
@cormacpro A rhetorical question, I know...but no, it's just subjecting everyone to the same miserable nonsense.
@brenstrong That's the spin out on it by Trump - cunningly done to divert the news cycle from the University settlement.
@brenstrong It was completely the audience, and only briefly. The cast statement was measured and thoughtful - a long way from harassment.
@brenstrong Yes, there was some mixed applause and booing at the beginning when he came in. The cast statement was at the end.
Now listening to match on the radio...always so tense #IREvNZL
When the ref says "we have to accept it", it's not exactly a huge endorsement of the TMO. #IREvNZL
@andymcgeady In the small cunning mind of Donald Trump, this diverts attention from the Trump University settlement.
This is one of the most chilling things I've read. https://t.co/C7YYV1vutG
@sabriste Assume it's a deliberate distraction by Trump to divert the news cycle away from the Trump University settlement.
@sabriste @HamiltonMusical @BrandonVDixon And they were not remotely rude - read a very open and measured statement. More lies.
@greg_jenner Glad to know you're in a better place. I loved your book, and thanks for sharing your journey, which can be painful and scary.
@MrPaulDuane But in truly excellent news, Bannon believes he is channeling Thomas Cromwell. Please, nobody tell him how that ended.
So I'll be watching #IREvNZL in town tomorrow on my own. Suggestions for where gratefully received!
@johnauldwebster Post-truth, alt-right...these sound like intriguing postmodern ideas, rather than what they really are.
@hughtweet Wouldn't that be nice! More an attack of infuriating clumsiness...
Life advice: consider not breaking a glass into 8 million tiny bits just before leaving for work.
@MrPaulDuane Good gig at the moment. Plenty of work on.
Having a tough day/week/year? Try these 42 beautiful seconds to help offset it. https://t.co/xYHAzLiuUb
@johnauldwebster My only aspiration left for 2016 is that I make it to the end of year without my head exploding...
